content:
• Friday, June 15, 2012
  • ZNGA

    Several volatile Internet names surged in late trading on option expiration day: ZNGA +10.7%. FB...

    Several volatile Internet names surged in late trading on option expiration day: ZNGA +10.7%. FB +5.9%. GRPN +6.7%. YELP +6.2%. Also helping Zynga is a positive note from Goldman's Heath Terry, who defends the company against Cowen's claim that Zynga's daily users are declining. Terry argues the user activity tracked by Cowen's source, AppData, doesn't fully correlate with Zynga's bookings, and the correlation is declining further as Zynga grows its mobile ops. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 3 Comments
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +49.4%) shares soar into the close; the only news on the...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +49.4%) shares soar into the close; the only news on the mid-size company is a report it filed suit against the U.S. government over the 2010 drilling halt in the Gulf of Mexico. ATPG alleges the moratorium cost it more than $68M. Shares had plunged 75% YTD through yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 10 Comments
  • LCPRF

    Lumina Copper (OTC:LCPRF +12.6%), long viewed as a potential takeover target, says it has set up...

    Lumina Copper (OTC:LCPRF +12.6%), long viewed as a potential takeover target, says it has set up a special committee to study strategic alternatives, including a possible sale. Lumina, one of mining entrepreneur Ross Beaty's stable of companies, controls the Taca Taca project in Argentina, one of the only world-class copper projects owned by a junior company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • APA

    Apache (APA +1.7%) says it has discovered "probably the best shale gas reservoir in the world"...

    Apache (APA +1.7%) says it has discovered "probably the best shale gas reservoir in the world" in a remote corner of northeast British Columbia, a massive field containing as much as 48 tcf of recoverable natural gas. One of three wells it drilled in the area delivered 21.3 mcf of gas/day over its first 30 days of production, which APA says is the most prolific shale gas test well it ever drilled.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 7 Comments
  • YPF

    Carlos Slim obtained an 8.4% stake in YPF (YPF +10.3%) as collateral for a defaulted loan, a...

    Carlos Slim obtained an 8.4% stake in YPF (YPF +10.3%) as collateral for a defaulted loan, a Slim spokesman reportedly tells Bloomberg. Slim's bank received YPF shares as collateral for a loan taken out four years ago, the spokesman says, adding that while Slim views YPF as "a solid company with good growth potential," he is still considering whether to keep the stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • OA

    The weight on Orbital Sciences (ORB +3%) has been removed with end of the SEC probe, says FBR...

    The weight on Orbital Sciences (ORB +3%) has been removed with end of the SEC probe, says FBR Capital. The firm says the SEC's review of ORB's filings was somewhat routine, but the conclusion of the probe with no changes needed to the company's reporting removes an overhang on the stock. It maintains an Outperform on the stock, citing valuation and the company's free cash flow outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +2.2%) has quietly put together a solid week with the help of an up-trending...

    Facebook (FB +2.2%) has quietly put together a solid week with the help of an up-trending market. However, shares remain down 24% from their $38 IPO price. Today's move higher comes amidst reports the SEC asked Facebook for more info about its revenue/user trends, as well as its revenue from Zynga's (NASDAQ:ZNGA) Facebook Credits payments, ahead of the company's IPO. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM +3%), hammered along with many other Euro tech names this spring,...

    STMicroelectronics (STM +3%), hammered along with many other Euro tech names this spring, bounces with the help of an upgrade to Hold from Williams Financial. It thinks STM is witnessing trends similar to those seen by other diversified chipmakers: its booking and backlog are stable, but chip buyers have become more cautious in recent weeks. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • ARCB

    Arkansas Best (ABFS +6%) moves higher again today after being upgraded to Sector Perform at RBC...

    Arkansas Best (ABFS +6%) moves higher again today after being upgraded to Sector Perform at RBC Capital on the back of its Panther Expedited Services acquisition and gradual improvement in its core LTL operations. The firm says the deal should be accretive.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +3%) rises after BofA predicts the company's bottom line will show a cyclical...

    SanDisk (SNDK +3%) rises after BofA predicts the company's bottom line will show a cyclical improvement in 2H and 2013-14 thanks to supply constraints for competitors (i.e. Samsung) and new products (MacBook Pro solid-state drives are cited as an example). The firm is lowering its PT to $56 from $64, but that's still 53% above current levels. SanDisk shares have been pressured by a major drop in NAND flash memory prices, and concerns about slowing smartphone growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • YPF

    YPF (YPF +10.5%) shares are jumping on news Carlos Slim has taken an 8.4% stake in the Argentine...

    YPF (YPF +10.5%) shares are jumping on news Carlos Slim has taken an 8.4% stake in the Argentine energy company, but Street Insider says the billionaire's stake may not be all it seems. Slim's stake could somehow be tied to loan defaults following the YPF nationalization; otherwise, it just "doesn't make sense" that Slim would buy into a nationalized company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR +3.5%) moves higher on positive comments out of its conference call this morning...

    Questcor (QCOR +3.5%) moves higher on positive comments out of its conference call this morning to discuss the commercialization of its rheumatology drug, Acthar. Oppenheimer says its highly encouraged by the not only the drugs prospects, but also the company's ability to execute its strategy, while both Caris and Jefferies say Street estimates don't factor in the drug effectively, and will have to move higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.3%) shares are hopping after S&P raises its corporate credit rating...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.3%) shares are hopping after S&P raises its corporate credit rating on the company and Citi follows by reinstating coverage of the stock with a Buy rating and a $26 price target, citing the full contracting of LNG's four-train liquefaction project at Sabine Pass.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • TSL

    Solar stocks are closing out a volatile week on an up note (TAN +2.5%). Option expirations could...

    Solar stocks are closing out a volatile week on an up note (TAN +2.5%). Option expirations could be driving some traders to close out their bets. Among the big winners: TSL +8.6%. STP +6.5%. GTAT +5.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • PES

    Pioneer Drilling (PDC +3.8%) shares are on the move after three insider purchases this week...

    Pioneer Drilling (PDC +3.8%) shares are on the move after three insider purchases this week totaled 37,150 shares at an average $6.92/share, for a combined $257,173, with the most recent purchase on June 14. CEO and President Stacy Locke bought 25K shares at $6.91 worth ~$173K.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • WAB

    Wabtec (WAB +3%) gains after announcing earlier that it's acquired Dutch rail and industrial...

    Wabtec (WAB +3%) gains after announcing earlier that it's acquired Dutch rail and industrial electronics manufacturer Mors Smitt Holding for $88M from investment firm Eurazeo (OTCPK:EUZOF). The acquisition will give WAB a broader array of offerings for the locomotive and rail car markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • ASIA

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA +11.7%) jumps on a Reuters report claiming TPG Capital, Silver Lake, and...

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA +11.7%) jumps on a Reuters report claiming TPG Capital, Silver Lake, and other P-E firms have shown interest in buying the company for over $1B. Even after today's rally, AsiaInfo's market cap stands at $903M. The company, a provider of infrastructure software to Chinese telcos and cable providers, received a buyout offer in January from China's CTIC Capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (COO +1.7%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform on valation at BMO Capital,...

    Cooper Companies (COO +1.7%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform on valation at BMO Capital, citing continuing contact lens market share gains and gross margin strength. The firm also raises its price target to $90 from $88.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK +4.3%) bounces a little following yesterday's huge selloff as M&A speculation...

    Nokia (NOK +4.3%) bounces a little following yesterday's huge selloff as M&A speculation grows, and Oppenheimer upgrades shares to Perform. The firm argues Nokia's woes are now priced in, and that staying short is "risky" until the impact of Windows 8 on the company's prospects comes into focus in Q4. The rally comes even though Moody's is downgrading Nokia's debt rating to Ba1 (junk) from Baa3 with a negative outlook. (more on NOK)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 4 Comments
  • EQNR

    Norway's Statoil (STO +2.4%) and its partners, including ExxonMobil (NYSE:XOM), submit formal...

    Norway's Statoil (STO +2.4%) and its partners, including ExxonMobil (NYSE:XOM), submit formal development plans to the Norwegian authorities for the North Sea Svalin oil and gas field, with the aim of producing 100K boe by 2014. Recoverable resources are estimated at 75M boe.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -2.9%) can't shake off that losing feeling as...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -2.9%) can't shake off that losing feeling as they dip below the $20 mark. This week's headaches for management include the news that single-serve competition is around the corner from Kroger and Safeway, while the overriding theme on GMCR is that the company hasn't solved the issue of what it will do to counter the patent expirations (I, II) that are around the corner.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 9 Comments
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN +2.3%) valuation looks attractive , says UBS. With the healthcare business...

    Nuance (NUAN +2.3%) valuation looks attractive , says UBS. With the healthcare business returning to double digit growth and mobile penetration accelerating, the firm says to look past the "market noise" and reiterates a buy on the shares. Separately, Craig Hallum ups the shares to Buy on valuation as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • BVSN

    BroadVision (BVSN +22.6%), a favorite of momentum traders and notorious stock promoter Jonathan...

    BroadVision (BVSN +22.6%), a favorite of momentum traders and notorious stock promoter Jonathan Lebed, is soaring again in the absence of any news. Shares had fallen 82% from their March high as of yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 7 Comments
  • MVIS

    Microvision (MVIS -22.9%) shares plunge to $2.32 after the company announces its stock offering,...

    Microvision (MVIS -22.9%) shares plunge to $2.32 after the company announces its stock offering, disclosed yesterday, will involve 4.2M shares priced at $2.50. The offering, which will yield net proceeds of $9.9M after underwriter fees, stands to boost the cash-strapped company's diluted share count by nearly 25%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar (NYSE:NAV) shoots up 10.5% with the prospect of dualing activist investors - MHR Fund...

    Navistar (NYSE:NAV) shoots up 10.5% with the prospect of dualing activist investors - MHR Fund and Carl Icahn - now on the scene. Shares now trade at a 30-day high.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN +2.8%) trades higher on an upgrade to Buy from Craig-Hallum. The firm likes the...

    Nuance (NUAN +2.8%) trades higher on an upgrade to Buy from Craig-Hallum. The firm likes the voice recognition software provider's fundamentals, and thinks its valuation has hit bottom following its recent selloff. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • VEOEY

    Efforts by Veolia Environnement (VE +3.4%) to address its debt and recurring lack of...

    Efforts by Veolia Environnement (VE +3.4%) to address its debt and recurring lack of profitability through asset disposals may bear fruit by the end of the summer, WSJ reports. VE's plans include selling up to €5B in assets in 2012-13 and slashing more than €400M in spending; a disposal of its U.K. water business is "near certain."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) +2.2% after receiving upgrades from Oppenheimer and CLSA. The former thinks...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) +2.2% after receiving upgrades from Oppenheimer and CLSA. The former thinks "near-term headwinds" related to a slowing Chinese economy and Sina's huge Weibo investments have been baked in, and thinks re-accelerating revenue growth, margin improvement, and the start of Weibo monetization will act as positive catalysts. The latter says checks indicate Weibo ads are performing well in spite of a weak Chinese ad market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • FDO

    Shares of Family Dollar Stores (NYSE:FDO) move down 1.2% in premarket trading after Barclays...

    Shares of Family Dollar Stores (NYSE:FDO) move down 1.2% in premarket trading after Barclays tags the company with a downgrade to Equal-weight on stretched valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • GME

    Shares of Gamestop (NYSE:GME) fall 2.9% premarket after data from NPD reveals U.S. retail sales...

    Shares of Gamestop (NYSE:GME) fall 2.9% premarket after data from NPD reveals U.S. retail sales of physical video games fell a steep 28% in May to $517M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • YPF

    Premarket gainers: YPF +13%. BVSN +12%. PCX +4%. Losers: SDT -6%.

    Premarket gainers: YPF +13%. BVSN +12%. PCX +4%.
    Losers: SDT -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • LNG

    Standard & Poor's raises its rating on Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) by two notches to B+...

    Standard & Poor's raises its rating on Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) by two notches to B+ from B-, saying the liquified natural gas company has effectively reduced its debt burden. S&P believes LNG will be able to repay its $205M convertible senior unsecured notes by the Aug. 2012 maturity. LNG +3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 3 Comments
  • GMXRQ

    GMX Resources (GMXR) +22.5% premarket after announcing it has successfully drilled and...

    GMXResources (GMXR) +22.5% premarket after announcing it has successfully drilled and completed its sixth operated horizontal Bakken well. Total Q2 production is expected at 539K-543K boe, which includes 60K-65K bls of oil.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • AIR

    Aircraft leasing and maintenance company AAR (NYSE:AIR) -4.7% premarket after issuing...

    Aircraft leasing and maintenance company AAR(NYSE:AIR) -4.7% premarket after issuing downside guidance. AARexpects FQ4 quarter EPS of $0.44-$0.46 vs. $0.49 consensus, and revenues $560M-$565M vs. $549M consensus. For FY 2013, the company sees EPS $1.55-$1.65 vs. $2.15 consensus, and revenues $2.1B-$2.2B vs. consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) +1.5% premarket after providing its fleet update summary, which includes...

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) +1.5% premarket after providing its fleet update summary, which includes new contracts and significant changes to existing contracts. Since RIG's May update, backlog associated with new contracts or extensions is ~$2.5B and planned 2012 out of service time decreased by a net 19 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 5 Comments

  • China, the world's largest cotton user, is reportedly looking to buy 1M metric tons of cotton...

    China, the world's largest cotton user, is reportedly looking to buy 1M metric tons of cotton from the U.S. to boost government stockpiles. Sources say 160K tons have been bought since last week. "The Chinese government has become the most important factor in global demand and supply," says analyst Dong Shuangwei, even as "the fundamentals still paint a rather gloomy picture." Cotton futures +2.43%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 AM | 2 Comments
